basics.name: Leen Abraham
basics.label: Bioinformatician | Research Scientist
basics.summary: Computational biologist specializing in multi-omics data integration, genomic prediction, and gene regulation in plant-pathogen systems. Strong communication and mentoring skills, with experience in high-throughput analysis pipelines and data science.

education.area: Biological Sciences(Strong focus on computational biology)

work.name: University of Cologne
work.summary: Led projects on epigenetic varaince contribution to complex traits and reference genome assembly in Arabidopsis lyrata.
highlights: Designed experiments integrating WGBS and RNA-seq in ~800 samples.
Applied Bayesian regression and ML (PCA, GBC, RF) for trait prediction.
Developed reproducible workflows in R, Python, and Bash using Snakemake.
Implemented FAIR data practices for large-scale studies.

work.name: University of Neuchâtel
work.summary: Studied genome-wide regulatory polymorphisms in a wheat pathogen population
highlights: Built NGS pipelines for RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, eQTL and GWAS.
Designed and analyzed fungal pathogenesis datasets.
Applied advanced visualization and statistical modeling.

work.name: ETH Zurich / CTCRI India
work.summary: Worked on developing mosaic virus-resistant cassava with ETH-Zurich and Indian partners.
highlights: Conducted research stay at ETH Zurich for technology transfer.

awards.title: Mobility Grant
awards.summary: Funded 6-month research stay at University of Birmingham.
